content.title: The Importance of Sleep
content.textWithGaps:
Sleep is essential for maintaining good (1)___. During sleep, the body repairs damaged (2)___ and strengthens the immune system. Scientists recommend that adults get between seven and nine (3)___ of sleep each night.

A lack of sleep can lead to serious (4)___. People who do not sleep enough are more likely to suffer from heart disease, obesity, and depression. Poor sleep also affects (5)___, making it harder to focus at work or school.

To improve sleep quality, experts suggest establishing a regular (6)___. Going to bed and waking up at the same time every day helps the body develop a natural rhythm. It is also important to avoid (7)___ and electronic devices before bedtime, as they can stimulate the brain and make it difficult to fall asleep.

Finally, the sleeping (8)___ matters. A dark, quiet, and cool room is ideal for a restful night.
